titlestmt.titleproper: Philadelphia Museum of Art Community Programs and Urban Outreach records 1969-1982
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Philadelphia Museum of Art Community Programs and Urban Outreach records

bioghist.p: The Department of Urban Outreach was established in 1970 with David H. Katzive as Director from 1970-1976. In 1977 it became the Department of Community Programs with Penny Bach as Director until 1979, when Clarence Wood and Don Kaiser were named Co-Directors.

scopecontent.p: Here are the records of the Department of Urban Outreach , and later the Department of Community. The collection also includes materials from the Samuel S. Fleisher Art Memorial under the administration of Thora Jacobson, and records of the Thomas Eakins house, which served as a Community Art Center until 1977 when it became autonomous. The collection includes correspondence of D. Katzive (1970-1973), Penny Bach (1973-1979), Don Kaiser and Clarence Wood (1978-1981), and J. Teamore (1972-1978). Subject files in the collection include materials related to artists, theater and dance companies, film and video, cultural institutions, art centers, and festivals Also includes project files related to the Visual Artists in Public Service program. Special Exhibitions and Events documented in the collection include The Expanded Photograph, Jacqueline Monnier Kite and Balloon Project, Five (5) Phases, The Mind's Eye, C/2 (City Over Two), Chalk-In, and mural programs. Records related to the Eakins House and the Fleischer Art Memorial include monthly and annual reports, correspondence, and purchase requisitions. Additionally the collection contains news releases, photographs, negatives, and contact sheets documenting events and exhibitions, mailing lists, and scrapbooks (disbound) of newspaper clippings (many photocopied).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
